ATTACHMENT ID: 12822627 - PreCommit-HIVE-MASTER-Build
Instead of changing the log level, an explicit parameter is added to remove the possibility of unintended data leak.

The description of *templeton.log.environment.enabled* is a bit confusing:

{code}
+    <name>templeton.log.environment.enabled</name>
+    <value>true</value>
+    <description>
+        Dumping every environment value, and the current configuration could be damaging, so this
+        configuration makes it possible to explicitly turn it off.
+    </description>
{code}

Removing the first comma would help, because with the comma it seems to say that the configuration itself is damaging.  Even better would be an explanation that "dumping" means dumping to the log and "turn it off" means setting this parameter to false.  Also, you're using the word "configuration" in two difference senses -- "this configuration" should be "this parameter" (or property or flag or another synonym).

[~leftylev] I tried to rephrase the comment:

{noformat}
        Dumping every environment variable value and the entire configuration to the
        log could be damaging, so this parameter makes it possible to explicitly turn it off
        by setting its value to false.
{noformat}

What do you think?
It this good, or further changes are needed?

Thanks,
Peter
That's good, thanks Peter.
Updated configuration description

ATTACHMENT ID: 12823611 - PreCommit-HIVE-MASTER-Build
Why not to use HiveConf.stripHiddenConfigurations since these properties should be in hive.conf.hidden.list?

Thanks [~ctang.ma]!

I will do that when I have time, but currently I have too much on my plate, and would like to finish other stuff first.
I have to check if there is no other sensitive data in the logs, but the one you pointed out seems a good solution it only hiveConf variables contain sensitive values

Thanks,
Peter

Used the stripHiddenConfigurations to remove values from configuration, as mentioned by [~ctang.ma] - had to refactor a little, so the stripping could be used for Configuration objects as well.

Used Utilities.maskIfPassword, to mask system property values, which contain the word password.

I think this patch is ready for review
Review proposed changes

The new one is related to this (https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HIVE-Build/1272/testReport/org.apache.hadoop.hive.cli/TestMiniTezCliDriver/org_apache_hadoop_hive_cli_TestMiniTezCliDriver/)
My guess is there was an error in one of the executors, since the TestMiniTezCliDriver was running on another instances. (for example: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HIVE-Build/1272/testReport/org.apache.hadoop.hive.cli/TestMiniTezCliDriver/testCliDriver_acid_globallimit/)

So all-in-all I think none of the errors are related.

Thanks,
Peter

FYI, WebHCat doesn't really have any JUnit tests, so these changes (at least the WebHCat part) are not being tested by the build bot.  Most WebHCat tests are under hcatalog/src/test/e2e/templeton/ and require a running Hadoop instance.
Thanks for the info [~ekoifman]!
Committed to branch-2.1.
Thanks [~pvary] for the patch.
